input_sentence: At intersections and junctions ego must yield to the other vehicles coming from right side of ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is on right side of ego

temporal_relations.description: At intersection or junction with vehicle on right, ego must yield

lexicon.other_on_right: Other vehicle is on right side of ego
lexicon.ego_yields: Ego vehicle yields to other vehicle

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: at_junction(ego) [unary predicate] 
   - ap_3: in_right_of(other,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_4: yield(ego,other) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Build antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego)
4. Build consequent: yield(ego,other)
5. Apply global property "Always" using G operator
6. Combine as implication: G(antecedent -> consequent)

Final MTL Formula:
G((at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) -> yield(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: at_junction(ego) [unary predicate] 
   - ap_3: in_right_of(other,ego) [binary predicate with related_object]
   - ap_4: yield(ego,other) [binary predicate with related_object]

3. Build antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego)
4. Build consequent: yield(ego,other)
5. Apply global property "Always" using G operator
6. Combine as implication: G(antecedent -> consequent)

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, which translates to "Always" or "Globally", indicating the entire statement must hold at all times.
- Inside, there is an implication `->` where the left side is a conjunction (`&`) of conditions and the right side is an action.
- The first condition is a disjunction (`|`): `at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)` → "ego is at an intersection or ego is at a junction".
- The second condition is `in_right_of(other,ego)` → "another vehicle is on the right side of ego".
- The action is `yield(ego,other)` → "ego yields to the other vehicle".
- The logical structure is interpreted as: if all conditions on the left are true, then the action on the right must occur.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or at a junction and another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or at a junction and another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

- The second condition is `in_right_of(other,ego)` → "another vehicle is on the right side of ego".

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
